All Reviews

  1. Looks like I am one of the unlucky few who experienced the opposite of what this shampoo is supposed to do. The first couple of times I used it, I lost significantly more hair during my shower than I have using different shampoos. I stopped using it, but decided to give it another shot after a month. Used it 3 more times, and each time, the same thing happened. Significantly more hair loss than when I am not using it. Pretty disappointed, given that this is not a cheap shampoo and it lead to very different results from what it claims.
  2. Great product, I have been using for years,
  3. Love this product. Saw results after first conditioning.. My hair is silky soft and fuller :)
  4. I bought this couple of weeks ago, makes your hair feel soft and cleans the scalp well. I like it and would recommend it. I do feel it has helped in hair growth as well even though its a slow process.
  5. Feels like I have super glue on my scalp, extremely drying. Conditioners I've used can't overpower the drying effect caused by this shampoo. Anyone with hair loss knowledge knows dry scalp is a big no-no as it contributes to hair loss. Yes, the shampoo may have some ingredients that could potentially help retain your hair (keep in mind there is no credible evidence to support these claims) but given its drying effect the net effect is certainly negative. I personally could of had the same effect using dishwasher soap, no good.
  6. Good stuff, Leave my hair really clean,and somehow add volume, hair is like more puffy
  7. On my second bottle, absolutely love this shampoo. My hair completely stopped falling out right away! and it is begging to thicken !
  8. This shampoo is the best! It not only helps preserve your hair, but it also gives it volume and shine. Definitely use the conditioner with it!
  9. Normally I have to wash my hair every day or sometimes even every 12 hours to keep it from being oily......:( Now, after use this product for one month, I think I can keep my hair clean for 36 hours. That is a encouraging start.
  10. After several uses, it seems working...the scent is mild and nice. Not much bubbles so you need to apply a bit more than usual. Most of the shampoo tends to cause hair loss but not to prevent, but this one caused less hair loss after the wash. The scalp does not feel the sting or itchy. For people has trouble with hair loss, definitely would recommend to try.
  11. I bought a bottle last month and I loved it. I have ordered two more from amazon.
  12. Only used a couple times seems pretty good, we will see if it helps at all with the hair loss. Do love that it's organic, unfortunately not a fan of their conditioner, as I know it is not ment for hair loss it is causing me more as my hair is still in knots after using :-(
  13. I used this shampoo for almost two weeks and I surprisingly found that the I grew some soft hair!! The hair looks more dense! When I wash my hair with this shampoo, it prevents the loss as well. I will keep using it and hopefully it can also help you to improve the quality of the hair!
  14. I use this organic shampoo for almost half a year. The initial idea is to explore the shampoo outside of brand name ones, and organic sounds right to do. I'll continue to try and probably come back with some updates.
  15. After two weeks use, I got less hair loss. My hair feels clean, soft. I'd recommend it to everyone.

I used John Frieda Frizz easy Shampoo + conditioner for the past 3 year and added a minoxidil 5% drops solution after every shower. The result for my hair was sticky, I felt drowsy in the mornings and happened to experience shortness of breath: no more.<br /><br />I bought this bottle just to give a try to all the good reviews on amazon. I know that Argan Oil is really good for the hair so I said why not. It is the 3rd morning I am using this shampoo and my hair looks and feels stronger. I used the conditioner after the shampoo the first time, although I realized that it is not necessary, my hair are just great with the shampoo only! So what is happening now is that I am using 1 product instead of 3! Hopefully this will prevent the hair loss as supposed, I will update this review in a month and see what happens!

  67. The ingredients in this shampoo are great and it does give your hair a fuller look, however it does absolutely nothing to prevent hair loss. I've been using this for a couple of months now and I'm still dealing with the same amount, if not more hair loss. FYI I'm a male with short-medium hair length. The shampoo itself is great, but since it's touted as a &#34;hair loss prevention&#34; product it deserves the low rating as it does not live up to its title. Also, the company offers to send you a free bottle if you give them a positive review, (which is probably why the reviews are so positive). The free bottle I received had different font on the bottle and slightly different ingredients, also the actual shampoo was different in color, smell, and texture. I'm not sure if that has something to do with quality issues, but regardless it wasn't comforting supposedly having two of the same product that were so different. Going to try another Argan Oil Shampoo that I saw on Amazon.

  76. This product works very well for me! After using it for about 2 weeks, I have noticed less oil in my hair, also the hair loss problem is starting to improve.   77. I have used the product for almost a month now, it smells good, a small amount of the shampoo can produces a lot of foam and makes my hair really clean. After I used the shampoo once a day, I noticed 1) I saw less hair in the shower tub after I washed my hair 2) The sparse area seems to show less skin. 3) A few hairs grew out on my forehead in the area that used to have no hair. I haven't tried to use the shampoo less or more frequently and see what the result is. I gave it four stars only because I haven't used it long enough to see the real result.

  101. This is my on-going review (3/9 - 3/16 and 4/14/2015) for Pura d'or Hair Loss Prevention Premium Organic Shampoo<br />and Pura d'or Premium Organic Argan oil Conditioner:<br /><br />March 9, 2015 - I received these products (shampoo & conditioner) on 3/6/15. Because of stress and not sleeping for almost 2 weeks when there was a death in my family, my hair started falling out, and over 2-3 weeks I developed 5-6 bald spots. I had been taking Biotin (5000mg per day), but thought there must be some kind of shampoo that would help my condition. I found it on Amazon. The first time I used the shampoo, I followed the instructions and massaged my scalp and got a nice lather. It rinsed out well and I didn't need a 2nd shampoo. Next I used the conditioner. It felt good and after a few minutes I rinsed it out and gently comb through my hair. To my surprise there was very little tangle and NO breakage! After I blow-dried my hair, it felt soft.<br /><br />March 16, 2015 - I've used both the shampoo and conditioner twice since 3/9. My hair is growing and is healthy, shiny and feels strong. I've got about 1/4&#34; of new growth where the bald spots were. Normally my hair is fine but it didn't have a natural 'sheen' like it has now. And where I didn't have bald spots, my hair is much stronger. It is fine textured, but now it doesn't feel limp and it doesn't look dull.<br /><br />April 14, 2015 - I've been using both products twice a week. My hair is growing - almost a full inch since I started using these products a month and a half ago. It's healthy, not thin or limp; it's soft-to-the-touch and has a nice sheen. I'm a 69 year old, African-American woman. Two weeks ago I was feeling so good about these products, I got up enough nerve to do some things to my hair that I wasn't sure would work out: I used a relaxer and I added a color rinse to cover the grey. My hair looks and feels great! And it keeps on growing. Don't know what I would have done if I hadn't foundthese products, which I will continue to use. I also told my hair dresser and a few friends who knew what had happened to me, about these products..<br />Pura d'or Shampoo and the Organic Conditioner are the best and I highly recommend them to anyone with hair damage or loss.

There are small 1-inch hairs all over my head, some are two inches so I believe I am regrowing my hair. Overall I think I am on the road to recovery. Also my finger nails are growing so quickly I have to file them every other day, which I think is a good sign. I have very fine hair that's always been very healthy and can grow quite long. My hair loss issue started sometime over this past summer. I had given my hair a bit of beating since last winter. In my attempt to ween myself off of shampoo and conditioner, which was causing massive build up and dandruff (even organic and expensive brands) I tried several different alternative hair care routines. I tried the baking soda and apple cider vinegar only routine, which I would never recommend to anyone because it completely dried out my scalp. High quality shampoo bars, coconut oil masks, no shampoo at all etc. I finally ended up at the the moroccan method and that helped a little bit, but ultimately I was not happy with the way it made my hair look and became skeptical of the 'detox' period the company claims your hair has to go through. My hair just looked thick and greasy most of the time. I still use their Euro hair oil but have abandoned most of the other products. Throughout this whole period large amounts of hair would come out in the shower and I started to notice my hair line receding and my part widening. Obviously it freaked me out. I'm a firm believer treating pretty much anything without a doctors help, because I have done so in the past with the help of my chiropractor and ayurvedic practitioner. So I got hard core in to the 'real food' diet and revved up my ayurvedic routine and supplement intake. I can't contribute hair regrowth solely to pur'ador because I am doing several other things to help with my hair loss issue, and I'm not sure if it's everything or one thing that is helping. I got my blood tested to make sure there was not a significant health issue. I eat a quality seasonal diet comprised of good meats and veggies, pasture raised eggs and dairy. I make my own pasture raised chicken bone broth which I drink daily. I am also taking blackstrap molasses daily (for iron), 5000iu vitamin d, fish oils and fermented cod liver oil plus ayurvedic herbs. I take high amount biotin and upped my b vitamins. I take an adrenal supplement my chiropractor put me on from nutri-west called DSF formula, which has made a huge difference to my energy levels. I also massage doTerra lavender, cedarwood, rosemary and frankincense essential oils, moroccan method euro hair oil, primrose oil and aloe gel in to my scalp an hour before showering to stimulate and moisturize my scalp. I bought the Pura d'or hair loss shampoo and conditioner and wash my hair with it every other day, sometimes every third day. I air dry my hair and I only brush it when it is dry, I only use a bristle boar soft brush. I installed a high quality water filter in my shower to remove chemicals and other unnecessary additives. I may get my thyroid hormones tested just to make sure that is functioning properly as well. I bought pura'dor because of the good reviews and am happy that my hair actually looks nice after washing. If I'm going to lose hair at least the hair that is left can look nice! I'll try to report back in the future but as I said before, I am happy with the product.

As far as the effectiveness for regrowth, I am not quite sure. I have not necessarily seen regrowth in hair yet but I have definitely felt like my hair has gained strength and thickness. The fragrance is fantastic which is another positive for those that are concerned about smelling good. This shampoo leaves your hair feeling clean, smelling good, and looking thicker. The ingredients are used to keep your healthy hair on your head and to minimize the shedding that comes with age. I would recommend this shampoo to anyone with thinning hair looking to keep the hair they have as healthy as possible.

  248. I tried Pura d'or Hair Loss Prevention Premium Organic shampoo when my hair started getting thinner and thinner, and I'm quite satisfied with the result. I haven't found a better shampoo for thinning hair yet, and I've sampled many. I've been using it for more than half a year now, and my hair looks noticeably thicker and healthier. Even my hairdresser has commented on the difference and noted that there has been more new hair growth where it's thinning. All the results without the harsh chemicals, too! I dye my hair twice a year and require sulfate-free shampoo to keep the color fresh, so this is one of only a few shampoos for thin hair that doesn't contain harsh chemicals and sulfates. Many shampoos will strip your color out, but this one doesn't do anything of the sort. The only con I can offer (hence, for me, it earns four stars instead of five) is that the fragrance of this shampoo is not the best. It's not disgusting, but it is a more organic, herbal fragrance and not something I would have chosen for fragrance alone. The results it gives, though, are worth giving up prettier smelling shampoos. At least its fragrance doesn't burn your eyes like Nioxin's does! I recommend pairing it with a good conditioner (Milk_shake is a great match!). Will Pura d'or magically grow you a head of luscious, celebrity worthy hair? No. But if you're like me and are cursed with thin or thinning hair, it could make you feel a whole lot better about yourself!

I keep losing the same amount of hair in the shower & after. I have also noticed that my hair became a bit dry, possibly because I haven't been using the conditioner every time I wash.<br />I do feel a bit upset & somewhat \\"cheated\\"...I now have to say that most of these miraculous reviews are probably fake.   415. I have been using this shampoo for about 3 months now and absolutely love it. At first I was skeptical because of all of the fake reviews, but this shampoo is great. The shampoo itself suds up very well compared to many other natural shampoos I have used in the past so I feel like my hair is actually getting cleaned. A key component to this shampoo is making sure you leave it in your hair for long enough! It says to leave it in for two minutes but I always try to leave it in much longer. I have truly noticed a decrease in hair loss and my hair feels much thicker. My boyfriend, who has premature hairloss, also swears by this shampoo. If you are experiencing hairloss, this shampoo is definitely worth a try and if you do decide to purchase, keep in mind you need to give it a couple months to see real results. At first I felt like it wasn't doing anything, but two months later is when I started to notice the difference. I think it took a little while for my body to get used to the change in ingredients especially after using chemical-filled shampoo prior to this.

  425. A noticeable difference. Hair looks a little bit thicker and I had a mild amount of regrowth. What more can you reasonably ask for? The trick to get a lot of lather is to apply after getting hair really wet then lightly rub on top of head. Very lightly. Don't try to get shampoo in scalp. After 20 seconds or so of that, you'll have tons of lather. I had an issue with this at first, but kept trying multiple methods. Now, I'm happy. And the shampoo smells great. It's nearly odorless and the odor it keeps just smells clean.
  426. This shampoo is simply Wonderful. I liked the minty smell, the longevity of the usage, however i'm not certain if it prevented hair loss. After each wash i felt it gave my hair more volume, more life, but during each wash the same amount of hair would fall off. I know it is normal to loose 120 strands of hair each day, but it is scary to see (and i counted) 60 strands fall off during regular washes. Aside from this, Pura d'or is a great shampoo at a reasonable price.

I don't use hair products after washing other than argan oil, morroccan oil, coconut oil or (Aveda product with ) Brutii oil so I can't say if it would clean other hair products in just one wash. I use about 3 -4 pumps for my underarm length hair. I leaves my hair a bit dry but that is why I follow up with oils after I wash. There is minimal scent to the shampoo, and it is clear (a youtube reviewer showed his which squirted out kind of opaque but mine is totally clear.   617. Awesome shampoo but not if you are a younger man who has not finished with facial or body hair growth.<br /><br />I've been using it for a year for hair loss prevention and it's made my hair both look and feel extremely healthy.<br /><br />But did some research on &#34;DHT Blocking&#34; shampoo. They block DHT on the scalp but since the shampoo runs down your face and body it is also blocking DHT on your face and body which can slow down or stop development of body and facial hair. Which is fine if you are a woman or an older man who is done with puberty.<br /><br />I've been using it for a year and prior to that my body and facial hair was coming in pretty fast and rampant but slowed down significantly since I've been using this.<br /><br />I hate to give it up because of how great my hair looks and feels but not about to sacrifice facial and body hair over it.<br /><br />I feel there should be some kinda warning on it that young men going through puberty shouldn't use it because had i known that a year ago i would never have bought it.
  618. I haven't used this long enough to determine its effectiveness on hair regrowth, but I'll state my opinion thus far. This is the first time purchasing this product, and so far I like it. The shampoo is extremely thick; so thick, in fact, that it takes a bit of extra water to get it to suds up. No thin, watery mess is this. So consider the comment a compliment. The scent is different, but not off-putting.<br /><br />The first few uses, I left it on my hair for three minutes to allow time for the infusion of the vitamins, etc., and it didn't cause any stinging or negative reaction (as some I've used in the past). So, another plus.<br /><br />Because of the thickness of the shampoo, and the resulting lather, it takes a bit to rinse out. Again, just stating, not complaining.<br /><br />Anyway, overall, my hair feels really clean when done. I will try to remember to update this review later, after I've had the opportunity to determine its effectiveness on hair regrowth.

  633. Wow! Wow! Wow! What a great shampoo!!! I'm a 40 y/o male and started to loose my hair. I try many products, pills, massage and any recommendations out there. The only thing I did not try was prescribed medication since they all have bad side-effects.<br /><br />It's been a whole year since I purchased this product and one full bottle lasted me a whole year using it every other day. I have oily hair so this shampoo is been perfect for me; yess it dries up your hair; but in my case, that's exactly what a shampoo needs to do. When I felt it was too dry, I just applied a small dot of conditioner, because normally I cant use any conditioner, since it leaves my hair too oily.<br /><br />After a whole year using this shampoo my hair loss is back to normal, not execive, because the hair falls for new hair to grow. Before using Pura d'or I was loosing over a 100 hairs everyday (yes, I counted them), and after 3 months of using this product, the amount of hair loss was between 60-70, using it everyday. Then I started using it every other day and my hair loss reduced even more. After 6 months my hair loss was normal (between 25-50 hairs every other day) and my hair is now fuller, thicker with more volume; which means that all the hairs i loose are growing back normally.<br /><br />Yess, I've always use gel on my hair, still do. No, I dont dye my grays, &#34;looks sexy&#34; like it is my wife says. Remember: If you are a male loosing your hair it's because DHT in your body that creates the oily sebum in your scalp bloking the pores, so this shampoo targets that oil in your scalp, the best way to make it work is by starting to use it during the early stage like I did; if you wait until you are completly bald I wont be able to tell you if it will work on you. I hope this review help many of you folks loosing your hair to stop it, like it did for me...Tnx, Eli

My hair already feels fuller, and even seems to be growing a little faster than usual. I'm not wild about the smell...it's slightly medicinal. It's not terrible or anything....in fact many reviewers seem to like it. It's a really nice shampoo and I'm eager to see the cumulative results in another couple months. Note on some of the negatives posted by other reviewers: *Lather - I experience low to moderate lather, and this is NOT a bad thing! Sulfates are mainly what cause all the lather, but those can also be harmful to your hair and skin. This shampoo states it is free from the main culprits of that. *Price - When you compare the $20-$25 price point of Pura D'Or to higher end shampoos that are also paraben, sulfate, gluten, and pthalate free (like Alterna), it is actually cheaper considering you are getting double the amount (16 oz). Comparable high-end shampoos are $20-$35, and they are only 8 oz.

  715. Pros: Gentle on hair and scalp, great lather for an organic shampoo, leaves hair feeling clean and healthy, and requires less product than other organic brands.<br /><br />Cons: The pump top on the bottle leaks water inside.<br /><br />I have been using this Pura D’or product for just over 2 years. Can I say it miraculously stopped my hair loss? I really can’t say; it’s not like I did a test using another shampoo on one half of my head. What I can say is I used various name brand organic shampoos before using Pura D’or and none of them worked as well. My hair felt softer and less dry immediately and within weeks of using Pura D’or I saw a visible difference in the appearance of my significantly thinning hair. I don’t think new hair appeared, but it seemed my hair was probably thicker and healthier. I also noticed less hair around the sink and counter after brushing and styling my hair.<br /><br />My biggest and only real complaint is the design of the pump top. I noticed my first bottle seemed to be lasting an amazingly long time. Eventually, I realized it was because water kept leaking around the pump shaft and into the bottle and it was mostly water by then. You have to keep it away from falling water or find a new top. In order to keep my bottle in the shower I took the better-designed top from my wife’s empty shampoo bottle and cut the straw short enough to fit the Pura D’or bottle. It doesn’t screw on tight but at least it keeps the water out. Hopefully Pura D’or has fixed this design flaw by now.
  716. It does what it claims. Too bad it doesn't grow hair the same way it prevents loss.

It's not great but certainly not terrible. I do really like the way my hair feels after using the product. I plan to keep using this for a few more months before making any final opinions. I will try to come back and give an update once I'm completely finished with the bottle.<br /><br />As of today I would recommend giving this a try. I wouldn't say that my hair has grown back, but I'm not sure that's what this shampoo is claiming anyway. It seems to be more of a preventative measure. All in all I give this a 4/5 with the possibility of being upgraded to a 5/5 in the future if things keep going well.

  736. I am honestly so pleased with the results! I am in my 40's and have been losing my hair and seeing it thin out for quite some time and thought there wasn't anything I could really do about it. It is thicker, now mind you, I have thin hair so it isn't lush or anything, but it is thicker for me. It has also grown faster and I just went to my hair dresser and before I could say anything, she commented on how healthy my hair was and how soft it was and asked me what I had been doing different! True story!! I am so glad I tried this. I will say that if you use it like a traditional shampoo and expect it to lather up into this glorious bunch of suds, that doesn't happen. You should just work it into your scalp and hair and not try to bunch it all up into a lather. Your hair will feel stiff, but as soon as you use the conditioner, it feels amazing afterwards. Hope this helps...I know how embarrassing it feels to have thinning hair and this really did work for me.

I haven’t been losing nearly as much hair (some hair loss is natural) and my hair has been growing faster than ever. I ran out a while back and tried using Nioxin again since I can’t find this stuff in stores. I ended up having Amazon rush me a couple bottles of Pura d’or and threw the Nioxin shampoo in the trash. The fact that it is organic is an added bonus and could explain why it works so well. It’s not going to be nearly as harsh or contain stuff that clogs up the pours on my scalp.<br /><br />I was initially skeptical because of the number of reviews on this product. I thought it might be some type of a marketing strategy that used a bunch of fake reviews which I’ve seen before. I was desperate for thicker looking hair so I purchased it anyway. Also, one of the bottles I received a while back had a sticker on it that offered a fee bottle of shampoo if I gave an “Honest Review” of the product which also explains the numbers. It did not say good review, just an honest one. This is the only shampoo I will use now, just wish I would have found this when I was younger.

  753. It's nice to find a shampoo without the harsh chemicals found in common/cheaper shampoos, and I do like the way it cleans my hair. It also suds up nicely, even without the SLS, if that's a concern for you. However, there are two items to consider. First, you'll likely need a conditioner because this shampoos definitely sucked the moisture out of my hair. Second, if you're hoping for a miracle hair-loss cure, you probably need to look at a prescribed medication or something else designed specifically for hair loss prevention. Maybe the vitamins and minerals work to reduce the hair loss rate, but if you're losing hair like I am, you're probably not going to stop the loss completely. I deducted a star due to the drying issue and the fact that the hair-loss prevention claim is questionable. All in all, I'll continue buying this shampoo (after my complimentary bottle for the review) due to my personal desire to have fewer harsh chemicals in my personal care products.

  763. I was sceptical about this product, but I had to try something to stop the mass migration of hair from my head to the shower drain. About 11 months ago I noticed that whenever I took a shower my hair was stopping the water from drain yen I was losing so much. After a few months of this I noticed that I was really noticing thinner hair in the front. I was starting to get really worried because my mother has a big spot in the front of her head that is almost bald and I did not want to end up that way. I chose this product for three reasons. 1) The price was reasonable compared to other alternatives therefore if it didn't work I wasn't out that much money. 2) I wanted a shampoo vs an oral option with tons of possibly scary side effects and 3). I like the that this was an organic product that is safe for color treated hair.<br /><br />I have been using this product now for five months. I put it on and lather it up. I usually take about 20 minutes in the showing washing, shaving my legs, etc. I leave the product lathered up on my hair the whole time and rinse it out last. After the first couple of washes I noticed that when I rinsed out my hair, there was no hair in the drain. This has held true for the last 5 months, if I do notice any hair it's only 1 or 2 strands not the fist full I was losing prior each wash. My beautician has stated to me on a couple of occasions as well that I have a lot of new growth. I color my hair once a morn and this shampoo does not leach the color out. In fact I feel that my color stays longer with this shampoo that with a very expensive color safe Lanza shampoo I was previously using. I do agree with other reviews that the smell is a very medicine like smell, but this can be easily remedied with a styling product or leave in conditioner. I personally have not noticed that this causes dandruff, in fact my scalp tends to be dry due to frequent color on my hair and since using this product, I feel that my scalp is actually lessdry. Overall I like this product. I have long hair and my first bottle has lasted several months. I have decided to reorder. The only reason I am giving this 4 instead of five stars is 1) the smell of the shampoo and 2) I feel as though I need to use this longer to make sure that it does not lose its effectiveness after long term. If I am still getting the same results a year from now, then I will change my rating to a five star.

I'm happy to say I now have lots of new hair growth! Yea!!

The only downside is it really dries out your scalp, so get the conditioner and maybe use Head and Shoulders once or twice a week. Overall, it's a great product worth your money, just be patient and understand you won't see results right away (but will definitely see them before you run out of a bottle...I'm 5 months in and still have about a quarter of a bottle left).

Even one 16 year old bald spot that was the result of an electric razor yanking out my hair follicles during a hazing incident seems to be coughing up some sprouts.<br /><br />It is worth noting that I began taking Omega 7 (sourced from anchovies, not sea buckthorn) around the same time and it is supposed to be good for hair and skin. However, even if this is what is responsible or a synergy of the two is what is responsible, my bald spot has gone from being alarming to being concealable and I expect it to go back to normal with continued use. I can't even squeeze out an amount small enough to be the least amount necessary. It suds up well and a minuscule amount will easily lather your entire head. I've only been using it for a week, so I can't speak to the effectiveness of its DHT blocking, but the ingredients check out and my hair feels great after using it. I love this product for the organic shampoo it is though.<br /><br />If used in conjunction with Ketaconazole shampoo, finasteride tablets (generic prescription Propecia), and Minoxodil (Rogaine) you could reverse your hair loss and grow back that lost hair.<br /><br />It's unlikely this item will reverse the process on its own, but it may decelerate hair loss.
  917. I only had 2 days so no results yet. Shampoo does feel nice though so far. Will update in a week or 2 when i got more use.
  918. Wow, amazing amazing shampoo. I seriously stopped having hair loss after I started using this shampoo, and I had tried to so many other ones prior to this one. Well done pura d'or. I'm buying this for life!
  919. I have been using Nioxin for several years but I had noticed more hair falling out in recent months. I put this down to a fact of life until I found out that Nioxin had been bought out some time ago by Procter and Gamble and that the original formula had been changed. I had some older smaller bottles I use for travel and compared them to newer bottles. I discovered all the old references to hair loss were no longer on the label either. I did some research and this came up with some decent reviews. It was kinda pricey for the amount you got (it is a little over double the cost of Nioxin) but I decided it was worth a shot.<br />The Verdict:<br />After about a month of use I can definitely say that my hair loss has significantly decreased. Where I was constantly finding my hair on my desk at work, I am now just occasionally finding a stray hair. There is definitely less hair in the comb when I get out of the shower also. I have not noticed any drying as others have experienced but my scalp is generally pretty oily so that was not surprising. I can't attest to any new hair growth as of yet but I'd say it is way to early to make that kind of determination.<br />As to the cost, while by volume Nioxin was definitely cheaper I am finding it takes about half as much Pura d'or to achieve the same lather so in that I'd say the cost is about the same when you factor in the number of uses yo get out of each. Overall I am pretty happy with it and will continue to use it.
  920. It's been a little over a month since I have started using this shampoo. I suppose that may not be long enough to give a definitive review, but so far I am liking it. To me, the smell is pleasant and reminds me almost like a licorice (which is strange because I don't necessarily like licorice but I enjoy the smell of this shampoo).<br /><br />Before I started using this shampoo I noticed that my hair seemed wiry and thin (talking about each strand). At this point, I cannot say that my hair is thick by any standard but it seems softer and less wiry.<br /><br />What I really like about this shampoo is that I don't have to use much at all. One push of the pump puts out about a nickel to quarter-size amount of shampoo and it lathers up very well to be more than enough for me. After a month, the level of shampoo left is right under the top of the label so I'm hoping one bottle will last quite a while.<br /><br />The directions on the bottle say to lather up and let sit for 2 minutes so I've just changed my shower routine to lathering my hair first, then doing the body wash thing, and rinsing at the end - seems to be just the right amount of time and doesn't extend shower time at all.<br /><br />If you're on the fence about trying this product, I'd say at least buy one bottle and give it a shot. At this point I'm thinking this will be my shampoo of choice from now on.

  1158. This was my third bottle of this shampoo in as many years. It's a good quality product that doesn't seem to dry my hair or weigh it down, and it does not contain the harsh chemicals found in typical drugstore shampoos. It also does not seem to have as much buildup over time that makes hair flat and heavy. It leaves my hair looking full and healthy with the right amount of body.<br /><br />My rating of four rather than five stars is because with each order I have seen inconsistencies in the product and bottle. Each bottle has been slightly different in terms of how the shampoo feels and lathers (my first bottle was great but barely lathered at all and took a bit longer to rinse out; my second and third bottle lathered considerably more, prompting me to actually use less at a time, and rinsed a little more easily). As for the bottle itself, each order has come with a different pump/dispenser, the first of which was the best, as it would dispense the perfect amount in one pump and could 'lock' easily for travel with a quarter turn. The pump on my second bottle dispensed too much and broke very quickly. On my most recent bottle, the pump is changed again and can still dispense too much at a time.<br /><br />Regarding claims of preventing hair loss, I feel this is bold and unrealistic. No shampoo is capable of overpowering one's genetics, so to buy this shampoo solely on the claim of hair loss prevention is a mistake. That's not possible. What it will do for one's hair is provide a gentle cleaning and act to fortify and nourish the hair one has - not damage it or dry it out - and this is why I will continue to use it.<br /><br />Of course, each person's hair is different, so your mileage may vary. But I recommend trying it. Don't use too much at a time, and the bottle will last a long while.

They all directly or indirectly promote Pura D'or products.<br /><br />See the following F.A.K.E reviews posted by Pura D'or. If they have reviewed only this item or only a few similar items...all with glowing reviews...be skeptical. After faithfully using this shampoo every day for 2 weeks, my hair started falling out at an alarming rate. After discontinuing use, the hair loss has substantially slowed, but the damage is done AND A YEAR LATER HAS NOT RECOVERED.

I have been losing my hair slowly for over 10 years and did not expect it to stop by using a shampoo. I also notice less hair after showering. My wife even noticed that my hair is thicker and stronger than before. While it may not work for everyone, it seems to work for some, and definitely for me. It product has a pleasant odor and lathers up nicely. The bottle seems like it will last a long time too. So I give it 5 stars because it is working nicely for me. I can't guarantee it will work for you, but I think at this price if you are losing your hair it is definitely worth trying this product to see if it works for you.

I can rub the crown of my head, and feel hair, not skin anymore. It is astonishing to me that in these last two weeks such a change has happened. Reading some of the other reviews, I have also experienced dryness from using this shampoo. It just didn't leave my hair feeling soft, but pretty dry and brittle. So I took another posters advice and stacked it with another shampoo, just a small amount from both and that dryness has pretty much gone away. I am very satisfied with this product and would recommend people to at least give it a try.

  1434. This is my second bottle and I'll be back for more because it works for me. I have noticed a significant reduction in hair loss since I started using this product. (I don't have any bald spots, so I can't say if the shampoo would have any effect in those areas.) I use 2 pumps per washing: one for the sides and the other for the front and back. (I have shoulder length hair, so you can judge for yourself how much you are likely to use.) I massage it in for about 1 minute and then let it sit for about a minute or two before rinsing. (Instructions say you should leave it on for 2 minutes prior to rinsing.)<br /><br />I find it to be economical as the 16 oz. bottle has lasted 10 months (That's 2 pumps per shampoo with 3 washings per week.) In addition, it's organic, free of parabens and sulfates, not tested on animals, AND made in the US! I also like that it is not a sweet, perfumy smelling product. It has more of a natural herbal scent. If sweet smelling shampoos are what you prefer, this is not the shampoo for you!<br /><br />If I had to give one criticism, it wiould be that it stings when it gets in the eyes. But then, almost every shampoo does that. I'm very happy with this product and am glad that I found it. Hope this review will be helpful to you in determining if you should give it a try.

Currently I use it with Alpecin caffeine shampoo and the combination yields the best results with loss down to a few hairs with each shower.<br /><br />Having used this product for nearly two years I can state the following:<br /><br />1) It does lessen hair loss with continued use. Positive results should be noticed within a month and the full benefit within three months.<br />2) My hair feels and looks fuller and thicker.<br />3) Continued use and leaving on for at least two minutes before rinsing is critical for improvement.<br />4) It doesn’t completely stop hair loss and won’t regrow hair from dormant follicles.<br /><br />I gave it four instead of five stars because I believe the claim of preventing premature hair loss is a bit of an exaggeration.   1676. I had a full head of hair until two years ago when I started taking testosterone shots to fix my hormonal imbalance. Shortly after starting that, I could run my hand through my hair and had an average of 5-8 hairs come out every time (even if I did it again immediately). Since testosterone therapy can easily turn into DHT (dihydrotestosterone) and that in turn shrinks hair follicles and make your hair fall out, I did a lot of research on what to buy that would help with that specific problem. My doctor tried to give me Propecia which keeps your body from turning testosterone into DHT, but it could have serious side effects so I decided to go another route. Things like Rogaine work for hair loss in the crown area of your head only, but at first it makes you lose more hair, it takes a long time for new growth to start (several months), you have to use it twice a day, and if you stop everything falls back out. After all my research I decided on this shampoo because it simply washes the DHT off your scalp. If you look up the ingredients in a search with hair loss you'll find several things in the shampoo that are natural ways to deal with DHT. It doesn't claim to make hair grow although I think mine got every so slightly thicker, but it does keep you from losing more hair. Or at least in my case. Make sure to follow the instructions, scrub it in really well, and let it sit a minimum of two minutes before you wash it off. Now when I run my hands through my hair I see an enormous difference in the amount of hair I find between my fingers. Hope this review helps some other people out and for $22 a bottle it's definitely worth the risk in my opinion and I've only been using it about 2.5 months and I still have 1/3 of the bottle left at least.

I don't know why it took me so long to realize it, but of course it is probably not good for your hair either!! Had a major \\"duh\\" moment when I finally realized it. Maybe my hair has just been getting really worn out! So I really love how natural the ingredients are, and the smell does not bother me. This has more of a right to be called \\"herbal essence\\" haha smells like a light blend of essential oils! So far so good, just going to keep my fingers crossed and give it a couple months to see how my hair starts growing back in!

I was told by a hair dresser once that a good shampoo does not lather...if that is true or not I don't know. Also, I have used this shampoo several times and I have found my hair to feel thicker and a bit fuller. My scalp has a slight tingle even on the next day which one may have experienced when using an organic type or dandruff type shampoos. I have naturally curly hair which is not tight curls but loose ones and the only negative I have is...my curls seem SLIGHTLY &#34;frizzy or separated&#34; looking even though my hair is not dry feeling - just has that appearance. My hair actually is soft without being &#34;too soft&#34;. I did not try this product's conditioner with this, but still used a good one that I had at home. I feel that if I use this on a daily basis, it might be too much. I have decided to use this just twice a week and see if that helps. All in all, I do seem to like this shampoo right now and well give it a chance and see how it goes. I lather it up the first thing when I get in the shower and leave it on for the duration of my shower, letting it sit on my scalp as long as possible. From a cost stand point, that probably makes this shampoo quite a bit cheaper than general use store bought shampoos. About the lathering, my house has significantly alkaline water, and (assuming you have enough hair left to lather with) the shampoo lathers up just fine.

  2302. I've been using this for one month, and have absolutely no idea if it's preventing further hair loss or not. I feel like it is way too early to tell, and it's difficult to understand what phase of the hair growth cycle I was in when I began using it. If you use this shampoo for one night, and you lose a ton of hair... you were probably going to lose a ton of hair in that cleaning and are far more likely to be looking for lost hairs as well. The same goes for if you shampoo once and find fewer hairs lost. Fully understanding your individual hair loss is something that takes years, and a lot of money. Your hair loss is not my hair loss, so I can not tell you what will work for you.<br /><br />Despite that, and this is the core of my review, this is a great daily shampoo when combined with the conditioner. I can style my hair the way I want to (at this stage of my hair life) and it feels clean and most important... not itchy! I'm going to continue to use this shampoo until things get worse (as they naturally do) and I get desperate (as I always do) and try something new (as I always do). For now, four stars.

  2333. I'm 32, female. I &#34;shed&#34; about twice a year, at which point, if it's too bad, I tend to just cut my hair shorter and the shedding stops. I cut my hair a bit shorter... but it still didn't help. *gasp* I'm like, legit losing my hair! ... is what I thought. Odd, though--none of the women in my family have had hair loss like this, and it's an &#34;all over&#34; shedding, not a bald spot developing. So, I wasn't really sure what to do...<br /><br />I stumbled upon this shampoo and figured it was worth a try. Unlike many reviewers, I'd like to stipulate that using this shampoo is the ONLY thing I'm doing differently. I'm not taking any biotin or other hair-related vitamins and I'm not using any other hair loss product like Rogaine.<br /><br />I have only been using this shampoo for a week (five shampoos so far), but I have to say... there is definitely a difference. Before, I'd get in the shower and every time I pulled my hands away from my head, my fingers would just be webbed with hair. Hair was all over my pillow when I woke up in the morning. It would get under my shirt during the day and make me itchy... This is not the case anymore. After one week, my shedding is about half of what it was. I can't tell if there's actually been any regrowth, but my hair loss is certainly reduced.<br /><br />I really didn't expect much... this was a &#34;meh... worth a try...&#34; purchase.   2415. YES, IT WORKS!!! I buy TONS from Amazon and this will actually be my first review, I know, I know, it's terrible, especially since we gain so much from customer experience, will definitely try to change that!<br /><br />But back to the matter at hand, this shampoo is really heaven sent. I started noticing some thinning, which to this day I can't tell you where my hair went since I never experienced any shedding, due to a beta blocker temporary medication I was taking for my anemia. But since my, down to my waist, hair was so incredibly thick, it took me almost a year to realize what was happening. (So thick I had to shave the back of my head, as if I had a bob haircut, in order to wear it down and my fam always said I couldn't possibly get lice because they wouldn't find a way to my scalp, lmao!). Like many of you I FREAKED and started the research, smoothies and vitamins route. I also got the many you're crazy I don't see it comments, but even though nobody could see it YET, I refused to wait until they could! Unfortunately, nothing gave me noticeable results. Then, one night, while searching for the 1000000000 time on Amazon, I came across this GEM, and due to the wonderful reviews, I decided to give it a shot...SO GLAD I did!<br /><br />I've used it ONLY 3 times and already see results! After the first use, the fullness was visible, my scalp felt so much better and refreshed and 2 days later the hair sprout began! After the second use my crown was no longer visible! It leaves your hair fuller, healthier, shinier and SUPER soft! (FYI: Results will vary since my hair grows super quick and the thinning never affected the growth, just the volume. Also note that it may be a combination of things I'm doing, of which I'll discuss below. That said, no other products I've tried gave me these results!)<br /><br />A Few TIPS: Since I usually wash my hair 2 times a week, in between those days I applied the shampoo directly on my problem areas daily and even used it as hair gel when slicking hair back for a ponytail. This way I could get as much of the exposure as possible without stripping my hair oils with excessive washing. (FYI: If you have issues with sebum accumulation, you're better off avoiding this TIP!).<br /><br />In ADDITION To The Shampoo I Have Also Recently Added: Biotin (10k for the last 3 months), Prenatal Gummy Vitamins (Started 3 days ago), Viviscal Professional Strength (Started 1 week ago, 2 capsules per day), Vitamin D (My level was at 9, :-O YIKES!!, when it should be around 100 to be optimal for hair growth. Taking 10k D3 a day for the last month), Fish Oil & Omega 3's (1 capsule daily), B-Complex & B12 (1 capsule daily), Calcium (1 capsule daily), Warm or Cold Lemon Water Cup Daily, Coconut Oil Hair Mask (Have done only 1, so far), My YUMMY Daily Ice Cream Tasting Smoothie (Wheat Germ, honey, almond milk vanilla, cinnamon, vanilla extract, olive oil & raw egg yolk), 3 Minute Daily Scalp Massages (With Wahl massager), Derma Roller (Done it twice so far, will continue to do once a week) & Castor Oil (I add it after the Derma Roller treatment, only twice so far. Go easy on the oil, dilute it if possible, it can get really greasy if too much is added).<br /><br />And last but certainly not least, patience...be patient! I know how extremely difficult it can be, but remember that your hair didn't get this way overnight, and therefore will need the same amount of time and hair cycles to fully recover! Don't focus on the loses, since that loss is most likely due to the hair cycle that has already been damaged, always try to focus on the gains, and slowly but surely your hair will recover!!! :-D<br /><br />Leyed it as hair gel when slicking hair back for a ponytail. This way I could get as much of the exposure as possible without stripping my hair oils with excessive washing. (FYI: If you have issues with sebum accumulation, you're better off avoiding this TIP!).<br /><br />In ADDITION To The Shampoo I Have Also Recently Added: Biotin (10k for the last 3 months), Prenatal Gummy Vitamins (Started 3 days ago), Viviscal Professional Strength (Started 1 week ago, 2 capsules per day), Vitamin D (My level was at 9, :-O YIKES!!, when it should be around 100 to be optimal for hair growth. Taking 10k D3 a day for the last month), Fish Oil & Omega 3's (1 capsule daily), B-Complex & B12 (1 capsule daily), Calcium (1 capsule daily), Warm or Cold Lemon Water Cup Daily, Coconut Oil Hair Mask (Have done only 1, so far), My YUMMY Daily Ice Cream Tasting Smoothie (Wheat Germ, honey, almond milk vanilla, cinnamon, vanilla extract, olive oil & raw egg yolk), 3 Minute Daily Scalp Massages (With Wahl massager), Derma Roller (Done it twice so far, will continue to do once a week) & Castor Oil (I add it after the Derma Roller treatment, only twice so far. Go easy on the oil, dilute it if possible, it can get really greasy if too much is added).<br /><br />And last but certainly not least, patience...be patient! I know how extremely difficult it can be, but remember that your hair didn't get this way overnight, and therefore will need the same amount of time and hair cycles to fully recover! Don't focus on the loses, since that loss is most likely due to the hair cycle that has already been damaged, always try to focus on the gains, and slowly but surely your hair will recover!!! :-D<br /><br />Ley

  2533. I have pcos and one of the side effects is thinning hair. There is noticeable thinning hair on the crown of my head. Because of the excess androgens, a lot of the pcos sites recommended an androgen blocker, or dht blocker, to help with the loss. I researched dht blocking shampoos and most of them have sulfates, which I am sensitive to. Then I found this shampoo. It has natural dht blockers in it, like saw palmetto and nettles so I figured I'd give it a go.<br /><br />I ordered the shampoo, and it arrived quickly because of the prime shipping. I started using it the next day. A couple of things- I dye my hair red and I also use generic rogaine to help with the hair loss. The shampoo, didn't seem to fade my hair so that was great. The rogaine helped with some hair loss, but the shampoo helped even more. I've been using the shampoo only a couple months and I have baby hairs popping up in areas that had no hair. I follow the directions- I shampoo my hair first thing in the shower and then leave it on my head. I finish the shower and rinse out the shampoo last and then I use a leave in conditioner when I get out of the shower. I love the smell of the shampoo- it smells like an herb garden! I also love the lather in the shampoo. I have chin length hair and I only need one of two pumps of shampoo and it lathers great when I first put it in my hair. I thought the shampoo was a bit pricey, but when I started using it, I found it was a good value. I still have half a bottle after two months of use. Another good thing about the shampoo is that it cleans well without drying my hair. Sometimes, I use sprays like My Secret Hair Enhancer to cover up the thinning spots. The shampoo washes it out completely without leaving any spots of the spray behind on my scalp. I gave this product four stars because the shampoo goes flat when it sits in your hair. What I mean by this is that it loses its lather. I like to let it sit and then lather it once more before rinsing, but it doesn't always have lather left after sitting in my hair for a couple minutes. Also, when I received it in the mail, some of the product leaked from the bottle-not sure if that is a packaging complaint or something that the manufacturers can prevent. Overall, I love the shampoo and I will definitely be purchasing it again!g, but it doesn't always have lather left after sitting in my hair for a couple minutes. Also, when I received it in the mail, some of the product leaked from the bottle-not sure if that is a packaging complaint or something that the manufacturers can prevent. Overall, I love the shampoo and I will definitely be purchasing it again!

  2645. So I started losing hair in February this year. I had been losing hair before as well. But there was something drastic about it this time. They say you shed around 100-150 hair in a day but I was shedding that much at one time when I combed my hair. I tried all kinds of supplements. Iron, Vitamin D, B12, Biotin but nothing seemed to be working. Then I came across this shampoo as the best seller on Amazon. I have been using it for almost a month now and I would like to share my experience here. After my first use my scalp definitely felt good but my head felt very heavy and had a headache that night and also throughout the next day. After 1st week of use my hair felt good and I was most definitely shedding less. So much so that I started getting worried it was so potent it might have other side effects I was unaware of. After 2 weeks of use my hair shedding had reduced to half but I started noticing subtle hair growth below my chin, on my neck and near my ear and side burns. ( I am a girl. ) This was definitely distressing for me. Hence, I did some research realized that the way this shampoo works is it acts like a vasodilator which means it expands your blood vessels and increases blood flow to the hair follicles. Unfortunately that works for vellus hair as well. After 4 weeks I could definitely see increased HAIR GROWTH ON MY BACK AND NAPE OF THE NECK. Also your HAIR LOSS WOULD RESUME if you stop using this shampoo. I don't know what the potential long term effects of a DHT BLOCKER are and if it is a LIFE LONG requirement. Hence, I would recommend that use this shampoo on a trial basis for a month, observe if you are impacted by any potential side effects and only then proceed to use it long term.

  2734. For those who are not sure whether to use this product or the Aveda Invanti 3-Step system, my pros and cons are provided below. Aveda Invanti 3-Step System - Very good smell, only need to use just a little bit of both the shampoo and conditioner and they lather pretty well using the palm of my hand without too much effort. The entire system does wonder for the look and feel of hair, makes hair look healthier, soft and shiny. I purchased the system (shampoo, conditioner and revitalizer), very expensive at $116 and the entire system lasted me about 3 months for the main purpose of preventing hair loss / enducing hair growth. I initially noticed less hair falling off but about 2 - 3 months after use (everyday showering), the amount of hair I lost was about the same, if not more, comparing to before I started using the system. That was when I decided to switch to Pura based on the reviews I see online. Pura - Comparing to Invati, the conditioner has equally nice smell, this one more manmade smell than the Invanti as the Invanti has ginsense smell. The shampoo however has a very strong chemical spell in my opinion. I use about three pumps for the shampoo in order to get it to lather up. The trick is to use my palm and massage it quickly without stopping. I use about two pumps for the conditioner to have a decent smoothness. However, I did notice that using 3 or more pumps of the conditioner makes my hair a lot nicer and softer. I've been using the product since December 2, 2014 and have noticed less hair loss. My hair seems thicker and fuller. I haven't really looked closely to see if I see any baby hair growing (according to most of the reviews) but I feel my tiny bald spot is somewhat covered now. My hair definitly has grown a lot longer so I take that the product is working as advertised. I shower in the morning and sometimes I wash off the shampoo and conditioner in less than the recommended amount of time needed for the product to work as intended. Willhave to try a bit harder to leave them on longer but I'd definitely say it's so far working better than Invanti. The price is much better as well. Will provide update by the time I finish the bottle.

  2882. I'm a 24 year old woman and the long term damage I've done to my hair was showing every time I washed it. I was afraid to look at my hands after washing the shampoo out, there was always a clump of hair in my hand. I tried Wen, which took me forever to actually afford buying it more than once and to no avail I kept losing hair...maybe even more! I panicked and researched how to stop this.<br /> DHT (Dihydrotestosterone) blocks the pores in your scalp from absorbing any nutrients that something like Wen may give you. And anything that may cleanse your hair has sodium laurl sulfate (like bleach to hair), and almost all shampoos have this. So it's a catch 22 when you have hair like mine. If you want a shampoo to slow or stop hair loss and give you back some hair this is the shampoo I would use.<br /> It has niacin in it, which stimulates circulation to the scalp and promotes re-growth. It's cleans the pores to remove DHT buildup using salicylic acid, allowing all the other nutritious elements of this shampoo to actually penetrate, clean, and absorb into the scalp and hair. It contains tea tree oil to keep pores clear and nettle extract, saw palmetto, pygeum extract, pumpkin seed oil and green tea extract to keep out DHT buildup. Also, biotin, rosemary oil, vitamin E and B-vitamin complex, which are thought to benefit hair health. Lastly, it contains he shou wu (fo-ti), which is thought to benefit hair growth. It is also known to kill the fungus associated with dandruff.<br /><br />I've only been using it for 2 weeks or so and already I can tell that this will save my hair. Down to 2-5 strands a shower now, as appose to the uncountable strands in the clumps I was losing. I can' wait until I'm 6-7 months in, when the shampoo shows its true potential!<br /><br />4/5 stars because this is only the beginning....otherwise I would give it 5 off the bat.

  2936. I think this is a good product.<br /><br />My Background: Norwood 2 hair/mature hairline, no apparent MPB, 27 years old when I started using the product (have used for 12 months now). I haven't notice any excessive shedding since I started using it, and the general thickness of my hair is the same as prior (moderate thickness). When I started using this product, I was not experiencing/noticing any hair loss, just wanted to be proactive.<br /><br />Good: the shampoo does use good quality products that have been implicated in the maintenance of healthy hair (e.g., see link below). I like that they use a very mild dirt and oil surfactant (the one they use in Johnson's baby shampoo, it's called cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine). Some people claim that this too is a harsh chemical, but I don't understand how you will separate dirt, oil, hair product, and general residue from your hair without some type of surfactant. To me, this is magnitudes of order better than SLS or other sulphate surfactants.<br /><br />e.g. research study, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4017725/<br /><br />Limitations: I strongly believe this product does next to nothing for those who are in mid-stage hair loss. Hair loss can be very hard to assess, happening very quickly for some, or slowly and awkwardly for others. Use your discretion, but In my view, this product does not have the backbone to regrow hair or even save hair that has lost its youthful robustness.<br /><br />Bottom Line: If you want to wash your hair with a natural product, and be proactive about maintaining healthy hair, I think this product is good. If you are losing your hair, my honest recommendation is to move to more aggressive treatments. I can't say how effective it is in long-term hair preservation, but the ingredients are supported in research as hair sustainers (though mostly orally, not much research into topical applications of Pura D'or ingredients yet).<br /><br />p.s., used the lavender conditioner, but did not re-order. I found it really dried out my hair.

  3025. It calms down my fine, frizzy, angry menopausal hair, cleaning without weighing down or stripping it. It's made mostly of natural ingredients- good for my hair and ecologically non-toxic.<br /><br />The price is exorbitant even considering the organic ingredients, but it's the best organic shampoo for my hair. I can't really attest to the effectiveness of hair loss prevention because I use generic Rogaine (Equate minoxidil). I stopped using the minoxidil on a regular basis which, possibly along with menopause, caused hair loss. I returned to use of minoxidil and started using this shampoo and my hair is growing back but I can't attribute it solely to the shampoo.<br /><br />If you're looking for something to address hair loss I highly recommend using minoxidil (2% for women, 5% for men) before trying Pura d'or unless you're committed to using only natural remedies, in which case you may want to read on:<br /><br />There was a medical study done in Scotland that showed promising hair growth results through the use of a combination of essential oils. The oils included rosemary, cedarwood, lavender and thyme along with grapeseed and jojoba oils. I tried this combination but didn't use it often enough as I only wash my hair every three days and the concoction left my fine hair too oily, but it worked quite well for the study subjects. I copied the following from nutritionbreakthroughs.com article named \\"A Natural Solution for Hair Loss\\":<br /><br />A revolutionary aromatherapy study was recently published in the Archives of Dermatology (1). Isabelle C. Hay and co-researchers from the Aberdeen Royal Infirmary in Scotland studied 86 people with diagnosed alopecia areata. The trial lasted seven months and while the trial took place, the participants stopped using topical (skin) and oral alopecia medications.<br /><br />Instead, half of the people used a blend of cedarwood (2 drops), lavender (3 drops), rosemary (3 drops) and thyme (2 drops), in a carrier oil mix of jojoba oil (1/2 teaspoon) and grapeseed oil (4 teaspoons). The placebo group used just the carrier oils. Patients were taught to massage the oil into the bare areas of their scalp for two minutes each evening and then wrap a warm towel around their head to enhance absorption.<br /><br />At the beginning of the study, and again after three and seven months, professional photographs were taken of each patient's scalp. Changes as seen in the photographs served as the primary outcome measure. Mapping and measuring of the bald patches was also done to determine results.<br /><br />An impressive 44 percent of the group using the essential oils significantly improved. The average area of hair regrowth with the essential oils was 104 square centimeters, compared with nearly zero for those using the placebo. According to one intriguing photograph provided by the researchers, considerable hair regrowth occurred with one male patient who had both alopecia areata and severe male pattern hair loss.<br /><br />These results show aromatherapy to be a safe and effective treatment for alopecia areata. The researchers were proud to have successfully applied an evidence-based method to an alternative therapy. Evidently, one or more of the essential oils is able to promote hair regrowth. And unlike standard medical therapies, the essential oils have a very low risk of side effects and are not nearly as costly.<br />______________________________________________________________<br /><br />Helpful Tips: After getting the essential oils, go to your local drugstore and get a small plastic mixing bottle with a pointed tip opening (that holds about 4 ounces), for applying the oils to your scalp. Get a small liquid dropper with teaspoon measuring lines for drawing in liquids. This is for measuring the carrier oils into the mixing bottle. Plastic gloves are helpful as undiluted essential oils can be very strong. The essential oil bottles come with a guide attached to the inside ofthe bottle mouth which allows for easy control of how many drops come out.<br /><br />Mix all the ingredients together and massage into your scalp each evening wearing plastic gloves. You can make up enough for 2 or 3 applications at once to save time. Use a plastic shower cap if you'd like to keep the oils working overnight, otherwise leave them on for at least an hour and then wash out in the shower. Keep in mind: the study described above lasted for 7 months, so give this natural remedy a good try, and enjoy the benefits of these powerful oils

I ordered Pura d'or and literally with just one shampoo, the amount of hair that fell out with that shampooing was half of what it had been. I must have developed some sort of allergy or sensitivity to the other hair care products, and this is so clean and organic. By the end of the 3rd week, I am losing very little hair with each shampoo and I can see the little hairs starting to grow back in now that my scalp has calmed down with this organic shampoo. It smells great, lathers (which most of the non sulfate shampoos don't lather so that makes it a bit more fun) and I do leave it on my scalp about 5 minutes and massage it in well both before and after those 5 minutes.
  3235. This shampoo is amazing! I was having hair loss issues due to hormonal imbalances and started using this shampoo. After about two months of just using this shampoo, I started noticing new growth all over my head. I have tried other hair loss shampoos but this one far exceeds anything else I have tried. The ingredients are pure and it does not have any synthetic perfumes that can irritate your scalp. If you are having hair loss issues, I would highly recommend this shampoo.

  3473. The short version of this review is that this shampoo plus prescribed finasteride 1mg worked amazingly good for my hair loss issue (seemingly male pattern baldness) just after 3 months of consistent use. Read on for details. **<br /><br />-- How It All Started --<br />I am a male in my 30s. I started noticing my hair thinning and falling off while combing and washing my hair about 3 months ago. It was probably a gradual process that started earlier than that though. I started taking pictures from above and saw significant thinning in the crown area. I was feeling quite miserable as no one would feel very good about losing hair. I immediately went online and researched on the best remedy. I found that the combination of finasteride 1mg (a prescribed medication) and some kind of shampoo that blocks DHT is the best solution. DHT is an enzyme converted from testosterone which will block and close off hair follicles leading to male pattern baldness. Taking finasteride 1mg also has an effect of stopping or slowing the generation of DHT in the body. The combination of the two have shown positive results for many. So I contacted my physician for the prescription and started my search for my hair loss shampoo.<br /><br />-- Choosing My Shampoo --<br />I debated between the Pura d'or and a few other brands of hair loss shampoo. Reviewers said Nioxin has changed its formula and it no longer works as before. DS Laboratories is too expensive. And a few others didn't give me a feeling that they are as natural as Pura d'or and some didn't even mention that they are free of sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS) which is the another substance that leads to hair loss. I checked the Pura d'or website and read the description of this shampoo. I like the fact that it is using 100% natural and organic substance in the shampoo so I decided to go with it.<br /><br />-- Results Will Take Some Time --<br />I washed my hair carefully everyday and I tried not to scrub my scalp too hard. For about two and a half months, I didn't see any positive results. I would still see about 15 to 20 strands of hair as I was washing my hair. I see hair falling off while combing my hair and I see strands of hair on my desk from time to time. About a month in, I almost wanted to give up and switch to Ultrax Labs Hair Surge since it contains caffeine to, supposedly, stimulate hair growth. I was desperate but Ultrax Labs is simply too expensive since I know that I will in this for the long haul. So I stuck with it and diligently took my medication daily. Afterall, the Pura d'or website did say it will take a few months to see results. Before and after pictures shown on the website were between three to six months.<br /><br />-- Conclusion After 3 and a Half Months --<br />About the time when I have used Pura d'or and have taken finasteride 1mg for close to three months, I started to notice my hair was not falling off as much as before. While washing my hair, I was seeing no more than 5 strands of hair. I was so happy to see this consistently and I was glad that I stayed with the Pura d'or and finasteride combo. I notice that my hair is more dense and I can feel it while combing my hair even at the area where it used to be thin. My wife actually saw significant improvement even AFTER a recent haircut. I am pretty satisfied with that just after 3 and a half months of treatment!<br /><br />And Pura Dor is not expensive at all. A 16 oz bottle costing $22 would last me half a year. I have gone through half a bottle in three months washing once a day, sometimes twice a day. And a side note on the cost of finasteride 1mg, it's about $27 for 100 pills from Costco. So this came out to about $150 per year for this treatment. Not too bad given how much hair transplant may cost or how bad I may feel if I go bald.<br /><br />One caveat, I was using Pura Dor and taking finasteride 1mg at the same time. So I can't say Pura d'or was fully responsible for my positive results. But give that my physician told me it may take nine to 12 months for me to see results from the drug, I have high confidence that my shampoo had something to do with it. I also take Biotin 5000mg on most days in a given week but it only makes hair healthier, it doesn't have any effect on preventing follicles to close up. But I assume it gives my hair a healthier look.<br /><br />If you feel that you may have or you are already suffering from male pattern baldness and hair loss is not a result of some other illness, give this a try.<br /><br />Help other customers find the most helpful reviews<br /><br />Was this review helpful to you? Yes No<br /><br />Report abuse | Permalink<br /><br />Comment Comment<br /><br />4.0 out of 5 stars Four Stars, August 20, 2014<br /><br />By<br /><br />Austin (Texas, USA) - See all my reviews<br /><br />Verified Purchase(What's this?)<br /><br />This review is from: Pura d'or Hair Loss Prevention Premium Organic Shampoo, Brown and Blue, 16 Fluid Ounce (Misc.)<br /><br />Just received the product, but after one use, my hair feels thick.<br /><br />Help other customers find the most helpful reviews<br /><br />Was this review helpful to you? Yes No<br /><br />Report abuse | Permalink<br /><br />Comment Comment
  3474. *update*<br /><br />9/27/2014<br /><br />so its been about a month and my hair is fuller and new hairs have been growing in where my hair line starts. not too mention the clean feeling it gives me and i use it every morning when i shower, also a little goes a long way. just lather it up. at first it didn't seem to be working well cause i felt like it was not absorbing into my scalp so i bought a soft bristle brush shower brush like this one<br /><br />http://www.amazon.com/Kingsley-Natural-Bristle-Shower-Detachable/dp/B004ZBH7SI/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1411828054&sr=8-3&keywords=Wooden+Shower%2FBath+Brush+with+Detachable+Handle<br /><br />i use the brush in a soft gliding circular motion on my scalp after i lather the shampoo and not only does it feel amazing but it also works well exfoliates, cleanses, etc . i have significantly lower dandruff and less itchy scalp still some shedding on the brush but nothing like how it was before. i leave the shampoo on for two minutes after using the brush i rinse with semi warm water.<br /><br />i hope this helps.

  3476. ** The short version of this review is that this shampoo plus prescribed finasteride 1mg worked amazingly good for my hair loss issue (seemingly male pattern baldness) just after 3 months of consistent use. Read on for details. ** -- How It All Started -- I am a male in my 30s. I started noticing my hair thinning and falling off while combing and washing my hair about 3 months ago. It was probably a gradual process that started earlier than that though. I started taking pictures from above and saw significant thinning in the crown area. I was feeling quite miserable as no one would feel very good about losing hair. I immediately went online and researched on the best remedy. I found that the combination of finasteride 1mg (a prescribed medication) and some kind of shampoo that blocks DHT is the best solution. DHT is an enzyme converted from testosterone which will block and close off hair follicles leading to male pattern baldness. Taking finasteride 1mg also has an effect of stopping or slowing the generation of DHT in the body. The combination of the two have shown positive results for many. So I contacted my physician for the prescription and started my search for my hair loss shampoo. -- Choosing My Shampoo -- I debated between the Pura d'or and a few other brands of hair loss shampoo. Reviewers said Nioxin has changed its formula and it no longer works as before. DS Laboratories is too expensive. And a few others didn't give me a feeling that they are as natural as Pura d'or and some didn't even mention that they are free of sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS) which is the another substance that leads to hair loss. I checked the Pura d'or website and read the description of this shampoo. I like the fact that it is using 100% natural and organic substance in the shampoo so I decided to go with it. -- Results Will Take Some Time -- I washed my hair carefully everyday and I tried not to scrub my scalp too hard. For about two and a half months, I didn't see any positive results. I would still see about 15 to 20 strands of hair as I was washing my hair. I see hair falling off while combing my hair and I see strands of hair on my desk from time to time. About a month in, I almost wanted to give up and switch to Ultrax Labs Hair Surge since it contains caffeine to, supposedly, stimulate hair growth. I was desperate but Ultrax Labs is simply too expensive since I know that I will in this for the long haul. So I stuck with it and diligently took my medication daily. Afterall, the Pura d'or website did say it will take a few months to see results. Before and after pictures shown on the website were between three to six months. -- Conclusion After 3 and a Half Months -- About the time when I have used Pura d'or and have taken finasteride 1mg for close to three months, I started to notice my hair was not falling off as much as before. While washing my hair, I was seeing no more than 5 strands of hair. I was so happy to see this consistently and I was glad that I stayed with the Pura d'or and finasteride combo. I notice that my hair is more dense and I can feel it while combing my hair even at the area where it used to be thin. My wife actually saw significant improvement even AFTER a recent haircut. I am pretty satisfied with that just after 3 and a half months of treatment! And Pura Dor is not expensive at all. A 16 oz bottle costing $22 would last me half a year. I have gone through half a bottle in three months washing once a day, sometimes twice a day. And a side note on the cost of finasteride 1mg, it's about $27 for 100 pills from Costco. So this came out to about $150 per year for this treatment. Not too bad given how much hair transplant may cost or how bad I may feel if I go bald. One caveat, I was using Pura Dor and taking finasteride 1mg at the same time. So I can't say Pura d'or was fully responsible for my positive results. But give that my physician told me it may take nine to 12 months for me to see results from the drug, I have high confidence that my shampoo had something to do with it. I also take Biotin 5000mg on most days in a given week but it only makes hair healthier, it doesn't have any effect on preventing follicles to close up. But I assume it gives my hair a healthier look. If you feel that you may have or you are already suffering from male pattern baldness and hair loss is not a result of some other illness, give this a try.

I lose about 100 strands every time I wash my hair. I wash my hair every other day. I was super excited to purchase Pura D'or and I used it as soon as I received the package in the mail.   3503. I have been using this shampoo since last July. My hair loss is the same as it was with any other hair loss shampoo I have tried. I like the smell of the shampoo. I use it every day and still have about a fourth of a bottle left. People complain about the foaming but it depends on your hair type for how much it will foam if you only wash your hair one time per showering/bathing. If you have really oily hair then it will foam less but it doesn't mean that its not cleaning your hair. If you prefer more foam then you can use a little bit and wash/rinse then repeat and the second time you wash it should foam alot. I wash 2 times every shower and I keep it on my scalp for about 2-3 min before rinsing the second time. It does help a bit with adding volume to my hair. I recommend people give this a shot if you are looking for something new. The ingredients are great and the price is currently cheaper than when I last bought it.
